text:
Robert Habeck (born 2 September 1969 in Lübeck) is a German writer and politician. He is a member of the The Greens and has been their leader since January 2018.
Habeck has been Deputy Prime Minister and State Minister for Energy, Agriculture, Environment and Rural Areas in the Albig Cabinet since 2012 and in the Cabinet Günther since 2017.
Under his leadership, the Green Party became the third largest group in the Landtag after the 2017 state elections.
